intro: Scutellaria purpurascens subsp. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple scutellaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of violet to purple flowers. Its flowers are tubular with two lips, a characteristic feature of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
